Create transcript information data frame from GTF file

Source: R/create_transcript_info.R
create_transcript_info.Rd

Imports a GTF file and creates a standardised transcript information data frame for use in the SCHT pipeline. Can optionally remove version numbers from transcript and gene IDs.

Usage

create_transcript_info(gtf_path, remove_version = TRUE, progress = TRUE)

Arguments

gtf_path

Character string specifying the path to the GTF file

remove_version

Logical indicating whether to remove version numbers from transcript and gene IDs (default: TRUE)

progress

Logical indicating whether to show progress messages (default: TRUE)

Value

A data frame containing transcript information with columns:

  • transcript_id: Transcript identifier

  • transcript_name: Transcript name

  • gene_id: Gene identifier

  • gene_name: Gene name

  • transcript_type: Type of transcript (e.g., protein_coding)

  • gene_type: Type of gene

Examples

# Using the provided example data
data(transcript_info)

# Example 1: Examine the structure of transcript information
print(head(transcript_info))
#>                         transcript_id   transcript_name            gene_id
#> ENSMUST00000193812 ENSMUST00000193812 4933401J01Rik-201 ENSMUSG00000102693
#> ENSMUST00000082908 ENSMUST00000082908       Gm26206-201 ENSMUSG00000064842
#> ENSMUST00000162897 ENSMUST00000162897          Xkr4-203 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> ENSMUST00000159265 ENSMUST00000159265          Xkr4-202 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> ENSMUST00000070533 ENSMUST00000070533          Xkr4-201 ENSMUSG00000051951
#> ENSMUST00000192857 ENSMUST00000192857       Gm18956-201 ENSMUSG00000102851
#>                        gene_name                transcript_type
#> ENSMUST00000193812 4933401J01Rik                            TEC
#> ENSMUST00000082908       Gm26206                          snRNA
#> ENSMUST00000162897          Xkr4 protein_coding_CDS_not_defined
#> ENSMUST00000159265          Xkr4 protein_coding_CDS_not_defined
#> ENSMUST00000070533          Xkr4                 protein_coding
#> ENSMUST00000192857       Gm18956           processed_pseudogene
#>                               gene_type
#> ENSMUST00000193812                  TEC
#> ENSMUST00000082908                snRNA
#> ENSMUST00000162897       protein_coding
#> ENSMUST00000159265       protein_coding
#> ENSMUST00000070533       protein_coding
#> ENSMUST00000192857 processed_pseudogene
print(paste("Total transcripts:", nrow(transcript_info)))
#> [1] "Total transcripts: 278305"
print(paste("Total genes:", length(unique(transcript_info$gene_id))))
#> [1] "Total genes: 78239"

# Check transcript types distribution
transcript_types <- table(transcript_info$transcript_type)
print(head(sort(transcript_types, decreasing = TRUE), 10))
#> 
#>                         lncRNA                 protein_coding 
#>                         152339                          58547 
#>                retained_intron protein_coding_CDS_not_defined 
#>                          22058                          14192 
#>           processed_pseudogene        nonsense_mediated_decay 
#>                           9328                           7247 
#>                            TEC                          miRNA 
#>                           3303                           2201 
#>         unprocessed_pseudogene                         snoRNA 
#>                           2163                           1507 

# Example 2: Find multi-isoform genes
isoforms_per_gene <- table(transcript_info$gene_id)
multi_isoform_genes <- names(isoforms_per_gene[isoforms_per_gene > 1])
print(paste("Genes with multiple isoforms:", length(multi_isoform_genes)))
#> [1] "Genes with multiple isoforms: 34459"

# Show an example of a multi-isoform gene
if(length(multi_isoform_genes) > 0) {
  example_gene <- multi_isoform_genes[1]
  gene_isoforms <- transcript_info[transcript_info$gene_id == example_gene, ]
  print(paste("Gene", example_gene, "has", nrow(gene_isoforms), "isoforms:"))
  print(gene_isoforms[, c("transcript_id", "transcript_type")])
}
#> [1] "Gene ENSMUSG00000000003 has 2 isoforms:"
#>                         transcript_id transcript_type
#> ENSMUST00000000003 ENSMUST00000000003  protein_coding
#> ENSMUST00000114041 ENSMUST00000114041  protein_coding

# Example 3: Filter for protein-coding transcripts only
protein_coding <- transcript_info[
  transcript_info$transcript_type == "protein_coding", 
]
print(paste("Protein-coding transcripts:", nrow(protein_coding)))
#> [1] "Protein-coding transcripts: 58547"

# Example 4: Prepare for use with transcript count matrix
# Ensure transcript IDs match between count matrix and info
data(transcript_counts_blood)
count_transcripts <- rownames(transcript_counts_blood)
info_transcripts <- transcript_info$transcript_id

# Check overlap
common_transcripts <- intersect(count_transcripts, info_transcripts)
print(paste("Common transcripts:", length(common_transcripts)))
#> [1] "Common transcripts: 137639"

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example 5: Direct usage - creating transcript_info from GTF file
# With version number removal (default)
transcript_info <- create_transcript_info("path/to/gencode.gtf")

# Without version number removal
transcript_info <- create_transcript_info("path/to/gencode.gtf", 
                                        remove_version = FALSE)
} # }
